text: Hi <@UQQ521JNN>, guessing you’re all set here but if you still need help here let me know.  Happy to answer any questions you have.

Hey there - is there a way to include form field values via a JS script WITHOUT handling the entire submission?

I have a HS form with hidden fields. I want to populate these two particular fields with data available on the submission page, which will be dynamic. But I want to do this without having to handle the entirety of the submission.

I guess I could use an onChange on another one of the form fields to trigger the hidden field population but this seems inelegant. Anyone have a better idea?

<@UQERM7BLY> I’m fairly inexperienced with jquery. I’m testing and seeing if I can get this to work. Trying to set the value of two inputs, with names of “firstname” and “lastname” to the innerText of 2 divs with ids of “first” and “second” respectively. Does this code below make sense?
```function($form) {
$("input[name="firstname"]").val($("#first".text())).change()

$("input[name="lastname"]").val($("#second".text())).change()
}```
You don’t need to use jQuery - you can use new Event /dispatchEvent
Truly appreciative of your help. Thanks a whole lot. I see where I went wrong. Going forward, JS it is.
